intro: Parishia insignis var. andamensis, commonly known as the Andamans Island Parishia, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species for horticultural collections.
